etymologies: late Middle English: probably from Old Norse fyri- (recorded in fyriskógr ‘fir wood’)

definitions: an evergreen coniferous tree with upright cones and flat needle-shaped leaves, typically arranged in two rows. Firs are an important source of timber and resins.

notes.text: Genus Abies, family Pinaceae: many species

shortDefinitions: evergreen coniferous tree with upright cones and flat needle-shaped leaves
